page.title: 07Treetops Residential Home.
page.content:
Julie Ablett's mother works in the office at Treetops, an old peoples' home where there are about 78 full-time residents.Each pays about Â£128 a week to stay there. They are looked after by trained staff who deal with their personal and every day problems.
The Home has 2 acres of landscaped gardens where the inmates can sit and watch the local wild life. There are three separate houses where they live- "Thretops", "Borrowdale" and "The Bungalow".
Recent comment argues that the old are neglected by their families. This may be untrue, but nationally, the old die of cold every winter and are often very lonely.
